info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 12:57PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Judith Basin and west central Fergus Counties through 130 PM MDT... At 1256 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stanford, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Occasional lightning, winds in excess of 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Brief heavy rain and snow. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stanford, Denton, Coffee Creek, Windham and Benchland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
